title: Ten rebels back in fold, boosting Tory ranks for election
text:
Boris Johnson has restored the party whip to 10 exiled Tory rebels and boosted the ranks of number of Conservative MPs ahead of the general election.

The Prime Minister met the MPs in his Commons office and told them they would be brought back into the fold after two months out in the cold. They include former Cabinet ministers Ed Vaizey, Greg Clark, Caroline Nokes and Alistair Burt, who voted in support of legislation which has forced Mr Johnson to delay Brexit.

But there was no reprieve for more determined rebels like Philip Hammond and Dominic Grieve, who scuppered Mr Johnson's last chance of avoiding a delay by voting down his tight timetable to get his Brexit deal through Parliament.

...
description: Boris Johnson has restored the party whip to 10 exiled Tory rebels and boosted the ranks of number of Conservative MPs ahead of  the general election.
